sen.j: 西園寺 治季（さいおんじ はるすえ、文化 (元号)6年6月14日 (旧暦)（1809年7月26日） - 文政9年7月9日 (旧暦)（1826年8月12日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Harusue SAIONJI (July 26, 1809 - August 12, 1826) was a Court noble who lived during the late Edo period.
Harusue SAIONJI (July 26, 1809 - August 12, 1826) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 光格天皇（119代）と仁孝天皇（120代）の二朝にわたって仕えた。
sen.e: He served at the Imperial Court during the reigns of two emperors: Emperor Kokaku (the one hundred-nineteenth Japanese emperor) and Emperor Ninko (the one hundred-twentieth Japanese emperor).

sen.j: 官位は従三位近衛府までのぼった。
sen.e: His final official title was Sakone no Gon no Chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) with the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 以降累進して近衛府、近衛府を経て、文政7年（1824年）に従三位となり、公卿に列するもその二年後に父に先立って薨去している。
sen.e: He was promoted to Sakone no Gon no Shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) followed by Sakone no Gon no Chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and he ranked among Court nobles with the rank of Jusanmi in 1824, but two years later, he died before his father's death.
sen.cmt: 原文に「近衛府」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、それぞれ「左近衛権少将」「左近衛権中将」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was promoted to "Sakone no Gon no Shosho" (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) after he left the position of "Sakone no Gon no Chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards); He became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1824, which gave him the title Kugyo; Nevertheless, just in two years after that, he passed away before his father died.

sen.j: 治季の死去後に実子の西園寺師季が誕生したが、幼すぎるので有栖川宮韶仁親王の王子の西園寺公潔が臣籍降下養子による臣籍降下して西園寺家の養子縁組となり、これを相続した。
sen.e: Although his biological son Morosue SAIONJI was born after Harusue's death, he was just a baby, so a son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito named Kinzumi left the house of the imperial prince and the Saionji family adopted him, and consequently, Kinzumi succeeded to the head of the Saionji family.
sen.cmt: 原文に「臣籍降下養子による臣籍降下」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「臣籍降下」として訳出いたしました。また原文中「養子縁組」もリンク先の用語となっているため、「養子」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Although his biological son, Morosue SAIONJI was born after Harusue died, the son was too small to become heir; Kinzumi who was a biological son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito demoted himself to be adopted by the Saionji family; Consequently, Kinzumi succeeded the Saionji family.
